results.title: The General [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: John Boorman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the true life exploits of Irish gangster Martin Cahill (Brendan Gleeson) who pulled off a series of daring robberies in the eighties, earning him the nickname, The General. John Boorman’s offbeat black and white biographical film (lensed by cinematographer Seamus Deasey), chronical’s Cahill’s blatent criminal reign and his eventual downfall, via an over-ambitious art heist. Boorman mines rich material from this unlikely hero who apart from having a very unorthodox relationship with two sisters (Angeline Ball, Maria Doyle Kennedy), became a folk hero in Dublin because of his open contempt for authority and his ongoing battle with the Irish police force. Gleeson’s performance is aptly understated, choosing to portray Cahill as an enigmatic figure forever concealing his face. Jon Voight as the frustrated police inspector obsessively in pursuit of Cahill makes a fine and sympathetic adversary. Cast also includes Adrian Dunbar and Sean McGinley. (Awards: John Boorman- Best Director 1998 Cannes Film festival)

results.title: Beyond Rangoon
results.creator_credit: John Boorman, Barry Spikings, Eric Plestow and Castle Rock Entertainment
results.brief_description: Patricia Arquette stars as American doctor Laura Bowman who flees to Burma on a package tour with her sister, Andy (Frances McDormand), following a family tragedy. Rather than achieve the peace and solitude she is desperately searching for, she encounters problems when the clash between peaceful protest and a militant government take an ugly turn. Andy flees the country, but Laura finds herself alone after being separated from her tour group, and without an identity after her passport is stolen at a political rally. She is befriended by a former professor (Aung Ko) who attempts to help her reach the Thailand border, and an allegory is drawn between a young woman’s plight to reach freedom and that of a nation facing political unrest. On their journey they witness firsthand the political struggle encountered by a group of dissidents. Cast also includes Spalding Gray and Victor Slezak.

results.title: Will it snow for Christmas? = Y aura-t-il de la niege a Noel?
results.brief_description: This is a moving story about a mother and her seven illegitimate children. But far from presenting life as a drudge, Sandrine Veysset conveys the pleasure of a children’s universe wrapped up in a land of dreams, play, and their mother’s love. Focussing on the mother’s extraordinary spirit and resilience in the face of the father’s cruelty and exploitation, this heart-rending story is set against the backdrop of changing seasons and the tough routine of farm life in the south of France. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Star maker = L'Uomo Delle Stelle
results.creator_credit: Giuseppe Tornatore, Vittorio Cecchi Gori, Checci Gori Group and Summit Entertainment
results.brief_description: From Guiseppe Tornatore, director of “Cinema Paradiso”, this is a story drenched in the filmmaker’s love for cinema. Set in Sicily in the early 1950s, it is the story of Joe Morelli (Sergio Castellitto), a con man who travels by truck from village to village posing as a film company representative. For a fee, he offers his victims screen tests, using passages from a script of “0

results.title: Field of dreams
results.creator_credit: Phil Alden Robinson, Charles Gordon, Lawrence Gordon and Gordon Company
results.brief_description: Based on the novel “Shoeless Joe” by W. P. Kinsella, this is the story of one man’s quest to transform vision to reality. “If you build it, he will come” is the ethereal message that inspires Iowa farmer Ray Kinsella (Kevin Costner) to construct a baseball diamond in the middle of his cornfield. At first “he” seems to be the ghost of disgraced ballplayer “Shoeless” Joe Jackson (Ray Liotta), who materialises on the ballfield and plays a few games with the awestruck Ray. However he gradually he comes to realise that his ballfield has been divinely ordained to give a second chance to people who have sacrificed certain valuable aspects of their lives, including a Salingeresque writer (James Earl Jones) and Doc Graham (Burt Lancaster), who gave up a promising career in baseball in favour of medicine. The film is a celebration of the love of baseball.

results.title: Voyager = Homo Faber
results.creator_credit: Volker Schlondorff, Eberhard Junkersdorf, Action Films and Bioskop Film
results.brief_description: Set in the 1950’s, “Voyager” follows the meandering travels of construction engineer Walter Faber (Sam Shepard) through six countries. Told in flashback, the protagonist relates circumstances behind the series of chance events that lead him to meet and fall in love with a strangely familiar young woman (Julie Delphi) on board a ship to France a, meeting that is to have tragic consequences. Based on the novel ‘Homo Faber’ by Max Frisch.

results.title: Manon des Sources [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Claude Berri, Gerard Brach and Renn Productions
results.brief_description: Second and concluding part of the story based on the novel by Marcel Pagnol that began with “Jean de Florette”. This part, taking place ten years later, deals with the revenge inflicted by Jean’s daughter on those responsible for his death. An absorbing tale that makes its leisurely way to an unexpected climax. Cast includes Daniel Auteuil, Yves Montand and Emmanuelle Beart.

results.title: The Dreamlife of angels = La Vie revee des anges
results.creator_credit: Erick Zonca, Francois Marquis, Diaphana Films, France 3 Cinema and Les Productions Bagheera
results.brief_description: Erick Zonca’s feature film debut is a subtle, unflinching, yet compassionate look at the relationship between two young women - Isa (Elodie Bouchez) and Marie (Natacha Regnier), who meet while working as machinists in Lille. The two are diametrically different in appearance, attitude towards life, family and friends, and most significantly in relation towards men and Sandrine; a comatose young girl (Sandrine’s mother owns the flat that Isa and Marie are minding). There are moments of real happiness between the two, and the initial stages of their friendship as it develops is captured beautifully, allowing the viewer to absorb the expressions of each girl and speculate about character development. Their paths soon begin to diverge however - unbalancing their friendship, when Marie becomes involved in a self destructive relationship with night club owner Chris (Gregoire Colin), and Isa starts to visit Sandrine after finding the girl’s diary and becoming privy to her innermost thoughts. As the friends drift further away from one another, they are both faced with situations that challenge them and influence their future both as individuals, and as friends. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Swimming with sharks = The Buddy factor [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: George Huang, Joanne Moore, Steve Alexander and Keystone Partners
results.brief_description: When Guy, a recent film-school graduate with big ideas, takes a job as assistant to major studio executive, Buddy Ackerman, he believes his ship has finally come in. Little does he know, however, that it is a slave ship, for his boss is indeed worse than a slave driver, delighting in abusing his new toy-boy. Guy struggles to push his idea for a script and feels he’s finally made it when Buddy congratulates him on a job well done. However, much to his chagrin, his conniving boss actually takes sole credit for the project, pushing Guy to his wit’s end. He breaks into Buddy’s Beverly Hills home and takes him hostage, then proceeds to torture him in a number of demeaning and horrifying ways. Cast includes: Kevin Spacey, Frank Whaley, Michelle Forbes, Benicio del Toro and Jerry Levine.

results.title: Secret of the pyramid
results.creator_credit: John Halas, Joy Batchelor, Joseph E. Levine, Robert Maxwell, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 44 of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
DoDo is a kid with extraordinary powers, and he knows how to use them. When he arrives on earth, DoDo has a series of adventures with Compy the Computer Bird and Professor Fingers, who can invent anything. From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode DoDo and his trusty computer bird friend Compy visit Egypt to help out the Professor. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.
